H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H977.def: = action by which someone makes a selection among several options, which include humans, divine beings, animals, other objects, or events

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H2091.def: = metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

H7326.def: = state in which an animal lacks what is essential for its normal needs

H6298.def: = process by which humans, animals, or deities come upon other humans or animals while travelling from one location to another, either or not expectedly; these encounters may be peaceful or result in aggression depending on the nature or intentions of one or both parties

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H6175.def: = state in which someone is be able to manipulate difficult circumstances in such a way that the outcome is favorable to the planner; ≈ sometimes used in a positive sense, but also used in a negative sense

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H6612.def: = person who is easily influenced by other people, ideas or one's own passions; ◄ because of his/her lack of wisdom and experience

H6064.def: = causative action by which someone in authority forces humans to pay a certain amount in monetary value or in kind, ► usually as retribution for a certain offense

H3374.def: = state in which humans experience fear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H6791.def: = small, sharp-pointed projections on the stem of a plant; ≈ associated with hardship

H6341.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H6141.def: literally: to be crooked (of a person); hence: = state in which  humans lack integrity in everything they think or do

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H2596.def: = causative action by which humans make a building or artifact ready for use, usually by a religious ceremony where it is devoted to a deity

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H2204.def: = state in which humans are advanced in age, ≈ and the body is no longer able to function as before

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H7326.def: = state in which an animal lacks what is essential for its normal needs

H3867.def: = action by which humans associate themselves with another human, a group of people, or a deity for a particular purpose

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H3615.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H1644.def: = process by which large bodies of water move back and forth as a result of natural forces

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H7036.def: = state which provokes disdain from the general public or from a specific category of people ◄ due to one's behavior or condition

H7673.def: = process by which an activity comes to an end

H157.def: = state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H2580.def: = state in which someone or something is physically attractive; ► which may bring about a favorable attitude in others

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5341.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H898.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H2351.def: = referent to the location outside of an object

H7523.def: = causative action by which humans take the life of other humans, whether or not intentionally

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H7745.def: = hole in the ground; ◄ either natural or dug by humans; ► can be used to trap animals; ≈ associated with danger

H2194.def: = action by which deities or humans give free expression to their anger regarding someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H7194.def: = process by which separate objects being joined together to form one unit

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H5288.def: = a young male, ranging from childhood to adulthood; ► often in the service of other people; ≈ typically regarded as healthy and physically strong, but also lacking the experience and wisdom of the {L:older men<SDBH:זָקֵן>}

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H4148.def: = causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H389.def: = particle marking a constituent as representing a limited number of entities

H4270.def: = state in which objects are found less in quantity or entirely absent in a location where they are supposed to be present

H5186.def: = state in which a relatively straight object is shaped into a curve

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H5273.def: = state in which a person or object has qualities that inspire love and appreciation

H8104.def: = action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H4009.def: = state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H637.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H3789.def: = action by which humans or deities mark letters, words or other symbols on a surface, such as clay, stone, skin, or papyrus, usually with a pointed stylus or reed

H4156.def: = action by which humans exercise their minds to determine how they are going to achieve a particular purpose

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H571.def: = state in which humans and deities are considered worthy of trust, because they are truthful and committed, with an unwavering disposition, which is reflected in their words and actions

H561.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H1800.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a building or room; ≈ used metaphorically to denote a person's lips with special focus on the lip's ability to shut the mouth

H1792.def: = causative action by which an object is deformed or pulverized by exerting heavy pressure on it

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7378.def: = action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H6906.def: = to take or keep for one's own the possessions that belong to someone else; ≈ agent: human; goal: human, divine

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7462.def: = action by which animals are feeding on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H1167.def: = person exercising authority over people, animals, or inanimate objects in the role of owner, ruler, or husband

H2534.def: = poisonous fluid; ◄ secreted by serpents, scorpions, etc. and introduced into body of victim by bite or sting; ► used by these animals to kill their prey and/or defend themselves against their natural enemies; ≈ often used to denote suffering and injury in a more general sense as well

H734.def: = relatively narrow {L:road<SDBH:דֶּרֶךְ>} that connects two locations and facilitates travelling

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H4170.def: = contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H6148.def: = action by which humans or deities take responsibility for someone else, taking upon themselves that person's obligations or vouching for that person's security

H4859.def: = action with which a person gives money or something of value to another person with the expectation that it will be paid back or returned

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H4904.def: = state in which humans are lying down to rest

H5769.def: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future

H1366.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2372.def: = process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

H4106.def: = actions by which deities act without delay

H4399.def: = an activity involving a physical effort and usually requiring a certain amount of training or skill

H3320.def: = action by which humans or deities take position in a certain place for a specific purpose

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H1077.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H2823.def: = process by which humans have little status within the society
